verses.verse: The <S%H1697>word<s%> of <S%H3068>Jehovah<s%> came again unto <S%H559>me<s%>, saying,
And <S%H1121>thou<s%>, son of <S%H120>man<s%>, take <S%H5375>up<s%> a <S%H7015>lamentation<s%> over <S%H6865>Tyre<s%>;

and <S%H559>say<s%> unto <S%H6865>Tyre<s%>, O thou that <S%H3427>dwellest<s%> at the <S%H3997>entry<s%> of the <S%H3220>sea<s%>, that art the <S%H7402>merchant<s%> of the <S%H5971>peoples<s%> unto <S%H7227>many<s%> <S%H339>isles<s%>, thus <S%H559>saith<s%> the <S%H136>Lord<s%> <S%H3069>Jehovah<s%>: <S%H6865>Thou<s%>, O Tyre, hast <S%H559>said<s%>, I am <S%H3632>perfect<s%> in <S%H3308>beauty<s%>.
Thy <S%H1366>borders<s%> are in the <S%H3820>heart<s%> of the <S%H3220>seas<s%>; thy <S%H1129>builders<s%> have <S%H3634>perfected<s%> thy <S%H3308>beauty<s%>.

They have <S%H1129>made<s%> all thy <S%H3871>planks<s%> of <S%H1265>fir-trees<s%> from <S%H8149>Senir<s%>; they have <S%H3947>taken<s%> a <S%H730>cedar<s%> from <S%H3844>Lebanon<s%> to <S%H6213>make<s%> a mast for <S%H8650>thee<s%>.

Of the <S%H437>oaks<s%> of <S%H1316>Bashan<s%> have they <S%H6213>made<s%> thine <S%H4880>oars<s%>; they have <S%H6213>made<s%> thy <S%H7175>benches<s%> of <S%H8127>ivory<s%> <S%H1323>inlaid<s%> in <S%H839>boxwood<s%>, from the <S%H339>isles<s%> of <S%H3794>Kittim<s%>.

Of <S%H4666><s%> fine <S%H8336>linen<s%> with broidered <S%H7553>work<s%> from <S%H4714>Egypt<s%> was thy <S%H5251>sail<s%>, that it might be to thee for an <S%H8504>ensign<s%>; blue and <S%H713>purple<s%> from the <S%H339>isles<s%> of <S%H473>Elishah<s%> was thine <S%H4374>awning<s%>.
The <S%H3427>inhabitants<s%> of <S%H6721>Sidon<s%> and <S%H719>Arvad<s%> were thy <S%H7751>rowers<s%>: thy <S%H2450>wise<s%> <S%H6865>men<s%>, O Tyre, were in <S%H2259>thee<s%>, they were thy pilots.

The <S%H2205>old<s%> men of <S%H1380>Gebal<s%> and the <S%H2450>wise<s%> men thereof were in thee thy <S%H919>calkers<s%>: all the <S%H591>ships<s%> of the <S%H3220>sea<s%> with their <S%H4419>mariners<s%> were in thee to <S%H6148>deal<s%> in thy <S%H4627>merchandise<s%>.

Persia <S%H6539><s%> and <S%H3865>Lud<s%> and <S%H6316>Put<s%> were in thine <S%H2428>army<s%>, thy <S%H582>men<s%> of <S%H4421>war<s%>: they <S%H8518>hanged<s%> the <S%H4043>shield<s%> and <S%H3553>helmet<s%> in <S%H5414>thee<s%>; they set forth thy <S%H1926>comeliness<s%>.

The <S%H1121>men<s%> of <S%H719>Arvad<s%> with thine <S%H2428>army<s%> were upon thy <S%H2346>walls<s%> round <S%H5439>about<s%>, and <S%H1575>valorous<s%> men were in thy <S%H4026>towers<s%>; they <S%H8518>hanged<s%> their <S%H7982>shields<s%> upon thy <S%H2346>walls<s%> round <S%H5439>about<s%>; they <S%H3634>have<s%> <S%H3634>perfected<s%> thy <S%H3308>beauty<s%>.

Tarshish <S%H8659><s%> was thy <S%H5503>merchant<s%> by reason of the <S%H7230>multitude<s%> of all kinds of <S%H1952>riches<s%>; with <S%H3701>silver<s%>, <S%H1270>iron<s%>, <S%H913>tin<s%>, and <S%H5777>lead<s%>, they <S%H5414>traded<s%> for thy <S%H5801>wares<s%>.

Javan <S%H3120><s%>, <S%H8422>Tubal<s%>, and <S%H4902>Meshech<s%>, they were thy <S%H7402>traffickers<s%>; they <S%H5414>traded<s%> the <S%H5315>persons<s%> of <S%H120>men<s%> and <S%H3627>vessels<s%> of <S%H5178>brass<s%> for thy <S%H4627>merchandise<s%>.
They of the <S%H1004>house<s%> of <S%H8425>Togarmah<s%> <S%H5414>traded<s%> for thy wares with <S%H5483>horses<s%> and <S%H6571>war-horses<s%> and <S%H6505>mules<s%>.

The <S%H1121>men<s%> of <S%H1719>Dedan<s%> were thy <S%H7402>traffickers<s%>; <S%H7227>many<s%> <S%H339>isles<s%> were the <S%H5506>mart<s%> of thy <S%H3027>hand<s%>: they <S%H7725>brought<s%> thee in <S%H814>exchange<s%> <S%H7161>horns<s%> of <S%H8127>ivory<s%> and <S%H1894>ebony<s%>.

Syria <S%H758><s%> was thy <S%H5503>merchant<s%> by reason of the <S%H7230>multitude<s%> of thy <S%H4639>handiworks<s%>: they <S%H5414>traded<s%> for thy <S%H5801>wares<s%> with <S%H5306>emeralds<s%>, <S%H713>purple<s%>, and broidered <S%H7553>work<s%>, and fine <S%H948>linen<s%>, and <S%H7215>coral<s%>, and <S%H3539>rubies<s%>.

Judah <S%H3063><s%>, and the <S%H776>land<s%> of <S%H3478>Israel<s%>, they were thy <S%H7402>traffickers<s%>: they <S%H5414>traded<s%> for thy <S%H4627>merchandise<s%> <S%H2406>wheat<s%> of <S%H4511>Minnith<s%>, and <S%H6436>pannag<s%>, and <S%H1706>honey<s%>, and <S%H8081>oil<s%>, and <S%H6875>balm<s%>.

Damascus <S%H1834><s%> was thy <S%H5503>merchant<s%> for the <S%H7230>multitude<s%> of thy <S%H4639>handiworks<s%>, by reason of the <S%H7230>multitude<s%> of all kinds of <S%H1952>riches<s%>, with the <S%H3196>wine<s%> of <S%H2463>Helbon<s%>, and <S%H6713>white<s%> <S%H6785>wool<s%>.

Vedan <S%H2051><s%> and <S%H3120>Javan<s%> <S%H235>traded<s%> with yarn <S%H5414>for<s%> thy <S%H5801>wares<s%>: <S%H6219>bright<s%> <S%H1270>iron<s%>, <S%H6916>cassia<s%>, and <S%H7070>calamus<s%>, were among thy <S%H4627>merchandise<s%>.
Dedan <S%H1719><s%> was thy <S%H7402>trafficker<s%> in <S%H2667>precious<s%> <S%H899>cloths<s%> for <S%H7396>riding<s%>.

Arabia <S%H6152><s%>, and all the <S%H5387>princes<s%> of <S%H6938>Kedar<s%>, they were the <S%H5503>merchants<s%> of thy <S%H3027>hand<s%>; in <S%H3733>lambs<s%>, and <S%H352>rams<s%>, and <S%H6260>goats<s%>, in these were they thy <S%H5503>merchants<s%>.

The <S%H7402>traffickers<s%> of <S%H7614>Sheba<s%> and <S%H7484>Raamah<s%>, they were thy <S%H7402>traffickers<s%>; they <S%H5414>traded<s%> for thy <S%H5801>wares<s%> with the <S%H7218>chief<s%> of all <S%H1314>spices<s%>, and with all <S%H3368>precious<s%> <S%H68>stones<s%>, and <S%H2091>gold<s%>.
Haran <S%H2771><s%> and <S%H3656>Canneh<s%> and <S%H5729>Eden<s%>, the <S%H7402>traffickers<s%> of <S%H7614>Sheba<s%>, <S%H804>Asshur<s%> and <S%H3638>Chilmad<s%>, were thy <S%H7402>traffickers<s%>.

These were thy <S%H7402>traffickers<s%> in <S%H4360>choice<s%> <S%H1545>wares<s%>, in wrappings of <S%H8504>blue<s%> and broidered <S%H7553>work<s%>, and in <S%H1595>chests<s%> of rich <S%H1264>apparel<s%>, <S%H2280>bound<s%> with <S%H2256>cords<s%> and made of <S%H729>cedar<s%>, among thy <S%H4819>merchandise<s%>.

The <S%H591>ships<s%> of <S%H8659>Tarshish<s%> were thy <S%H7788>caravans<s%> for thy <S%H4627>merchandise<s%>: and thou wast <S%H4390>replenished<s%>, and made <S%H3966>very<s%> <S%H3513>glorious<s%> in the <S%H3820>heart<s%> of the <S%H3220>seas<s%>.

Thy <S%H7751>rowers<s%> have <S%H935>brought<s%> thee into <S%H7227>great<s%> <S%H4325>waters<s%>: the <S%H6921>east<s%> <S%H7307>wind<s%> hath <S%H7665>broken<s%> thee in the <S%H3820>heart<s%> of the <S%H3220>seas<s%>.

Thy <S%H1952>riches<s%>, and thy <S%H5801>wares<s%>, thy <S%H4627>merchandise<s%>, thy <S%H4419>mariners<s%>, and thy <S%H2259>pilots<s%>, thy <S%H919>calkers<s%>, and the <S%H6148>dealers<s%> in thy <S%H4627>merchandise<s%>, and all thy <S%H582>men<s%> of <S%H4421>war<s%>, that are in <S%H6951>thee<s%>, with all thy company which is in the <S%H8432>midst<s%> of <S%H5307>thee<s%>, shall fall into the <S%H3820>heart<s%> of the <S%H3220>seas<s%> in the <S%H3117>day<s%> of thy <S%H4658>ruin<s%>.
At the <S%H6963>sound<s%> of the <S%H2201>cry<s%> of thy <S%H2259>pilots<s%> the <S%H4054>suburbs<s%> shall <S%H7493>shake<s%>.

And all that <S%H8610>handled<s%> the <S%H4880>oar<s%>, the <S%H4419>mariners<s%>, and all the <S%H2259>pilots<s%> of the <S%H3220>sea<s%>, shall come <S%H3381>down<s%> from their <S%H591>ships<s%>; they shall <S%H5975>stand<s%> upon the <S%H776>land<s%>,

and shall cause their <S%H6963>voice<s%> to be <S%H8085>heard<s%> over <S%H2199>thee<s%>, and shall cry <S%H4751>bitterly<s%>, and shall cast <S%H5927>up<s%> <S%H6083>dust<s%> upon their <S%H7218>heads<s%>, they shall <S%H6428>wallow<s%> themselves in the <S%H665>ashes<s%>:

and they shall <S%H7144>make<s%> themselves <S%H7139>bald<s%> for <S%H2296>thee<s%>, and gird them with <S%H8242>sackcloth<s%>, and they shall <S%H1058>weep<s%> for thee in <S%H4751>bitterness<s%> of <S%H5315>soul<s%> with <S%H4751>bitter<s%> <S%H4553>mourning<s%>.

And in their <S%H5204>wailing<s%> they shall take <S%H5375>up<s%> a <S%H7015>lamentation<s%> for <S%H6969>thee<s%>, and lament over <S%H6865>thee<s%>, saying, Who is there like Tyre, like her that is brought to <S%H1822>silence<s%> in the <S%H8432>midst<s%> of the <S%H3220>sea<s%>?

When thy <S%H5801>wares<s%> went <S%H3318>forth<s%> out of the <S%H3220>seas<s%>, thou <S%H7646>filledst<s%> <S%H7227>many<s%> <S%H5971>peoples<s%>; thou didst <S%H6238>enrich<s%> the <S%H4428>kings<s%> of the <S%H776>earth<s%> with the <S%H7230>multitude<s%> of thy <S%H1952>riches<s%> and of thy <S%H4627>merchandise<s%>.

In the <S%H6256>time<s%> that thou wast <S%H7665>broken<s%> by the <S%H3220>seas<s%> in the <S%H4615>depths<s%> of the <S%H4325>waters<s%>, thy <S%H4627>merchandise<s%> and all thy <S%H6951>company<s%> did <S%H5307>fall<s%> in the midst of <S%H8432>thee<s%>.

All the <S%H3427>inhabitants<s%> of the <S%H339>isles<s%> are <S%H8074>astonished<s%> at <S%H4428>thee<s%>, and their kings are <S%H8178>horribly<s%> <S%H8175>afraid<s%>; they are <S%H7481>troubled<s%> in their <S%H6440>countenance<s%>.
The <S%H5503>merchants<s%> among the <S%H5971>peoples<s%> <S%H8319>hiss<s%> at <S%H1091>thee<s%>; thou art become a terror, and thou shalt nevermore have any <S%H5704>being<s%>.
